perturbation.original_text: If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to VerticalNet was underpaid, the additional amount owed shall be paid to VerticalNet within 15 days of notice of such underpayment to LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to VerticalNet was underpaid in excess of 10% of the amount owed, the fees of such audit shall also be paid to VerticalNet within 15 days of notice of such to LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to
perturbation.changed_text: If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to VerticalNet was underpaid, the additional amount owed shall be paid to VerticalNet within 5 days of notice of such underpayment to LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to VerticalNet was underpaid in excess of 10% of the amount owed, the fees of such audit shall also be paid to VerticalNet within 5 days of notice of such to LeadersOnline.  If the amount owed by LeadersOnline to
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a 15-day payment window for underpaid amounts following an audit. This has been shortened to 5 days. Such a short payment period may violate state laws requiring a reasonable timeframe for businesses to address discrepancies and remit payments, especially considering potential complexities in accounting and reconciliation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state-specific prompt payment laws and general principles of 'reasonable time' for contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party in the event of any material breach of a term of this Agreement by such other Party that remains uncured 30 days after notice of such breach was received by such other Party or, if the breach is not reasonably capable of cure within 30 days, such longer period, not to exceed 60 days, so long as the cure is commenced within the 30-day period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible and in any event within 60 days.
perturbation.changed_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the other Party in the event of any material breach of a term of this Agreement by such other Party that remains uncured 10 days after notice of such breach was received by such other Party or, if the breach is not reasonably capable of cure within 10 days, such longer period, not to exceed 20 days, so long as the cure is commenced within the 10-day period and thereafter is diligently prosecuted to completion as soon as possible and in any event within 20 days.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows a 30-60 day cure period for breaches. The modified text reduces this to 10-20 days. This shorter cure period may be deemed unreasonable and conflict with principles of good faith and fair dealing, particularly for complex breaches that require more time to resolve. Some jurisdictions require 'reasonable' cure periods which this might contradict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential conflict with implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing and state laws requiring 'reasonable' opportunity to cure breaches.

perturbation.original_text: To exercise this option, LeadersOnline must notify VerticalNet in writing of its election no later than 90 days prior to the expiration of the initial Term. Unless VerticalNet notifies LeadersOnline of its intention to extend the initial Term of this Agreement for an additional year within 30 days of receiving such notice the Agreement shall terminate in accordance with the terms hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: To exercise this option, LeadersOnline must notify VerticalNet in writing of its election no later than 15 days prior to the expiration of the initial Term. Unless VerticalNet notifies LeadersOnline of its intention to extend the initial Term of this Agreement for an additional year within 5 days of receiving such notice the Agreement shall terminate in accordance with the terms hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a 90-day notification period for renewal by LeadersOnline and a 30-day response from VerticalNet. The revised terms shorten these periods to 15 and 5 days respectively. Such a condensed notification period could be considered commercially unreasonable, especially concerning the complexity and significance of renewing such agreements. The original time frame provides a more practical frame to decide to renew a partnership than the changed values.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates principles of commercial reasonableness and fair notice, which could render the renewal clause unenforceable under contract law.
